input: Charlie is smart. Erin is not blue. Erin is green. Erin is red. Erin is white. Fiona is red. Gary is white. If something is white and nice then it is kind. All smart things are nice. If something is green then it is white. If something is white then it is smart. If something is green and blue then it is not smart. All red, white things are not blue. All green things are not blue. If Fiona is smart then Fiona is not blue. Nice, kind things are red. Question: Gary is blue.?
output:
universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Charlie : obj
constant Erin : obj
constant Fiona : obj
constant Gary : obj

constant Smart : obj → Prop
constant Blue : obj → Prop
constant Green : obj → Prop
constant Red : obj → Prop
constant White : obj → Prop
constant Nice : obj → Prop
constant Kind : obj → Prop

axiom T1 : Smart Charlie
axiom T2 : ¬ Blue Erin
axiom T3 : Green Erin
axiom T4 : Red Erin
axiom T5 : White Erin
axiom T6 : Red Fiona
axiom T7 : White Gary

axiom R1 : ∀ x : obj, White x ∧ Nice x → Kind x
axiom R2 : ∀ x : obj, Smart x → Nice x
axiom R3 : ∀ x : obj, Green x → White x
axiom R4 : ∀ x : obj, White x → Smart x
axiom R5 : ∀ x : obj, Green x ∧ Blue x → ¬ Smart x
axiom R6 : ∀ x : obj, Red x ∧ White x → ¬ Blue x
axiom R7 : ∀ x : obj, Green x → ¬ Blue x
axiom R8 : Smart Fiona → ¬ Blue Fiona
axiom R9 : ∀ x : obj, Nice x ∧ Kind x → Red x

theorem gary_is_blue : Blue Gary :=
begin
  sorry
end

-- Looks like it cannot be proven in Lean.
-- So let's try to prove the negation of the theorem, which is Gary is not blue

theorem not_gary_is_blue : ¬ Blue Gary :=
begin
  apply R6 Gary,
  split,
  exact T7,
  apply R4,
  exact T7,
end

-- It can be proven in Lean. So
-- The answer is False
